abstract: Baltimore City Judge Barry G Williams rules that jurors in trial of police officer William G Porter will remain anonymous in effort to avoid subjecting them to public harassment of any kind; Porter is first of six officers charged in death of black man Freddie Gray, who sustained spinal injury after being arrested in April.
lead_paragraph: The judge cited potential “undue harassment” of jurors in the trial of the first of six police officers charged in the death of Mr. Gray, a black man who suffered a spinal injury after his arrest.

headline.main: Identities of Jurors in Trial Over Freddie Gray’s Death Will Be Shielded
headline.print_headline: Police Trial Will Shield Identities of Jurors

snippet: The judge cited potential “undue harassment” of jurors in the trial of the first of six police officers charged in the death of Mr. Gray, a black man who suffered a spinal injury after his arrest.
